title: Can you get banned for Mod Skin LoL?
body: I downloaded the program from modskinpro.com, is it possible to get banned for using it? thanks.

replies.body: We don't support any third party programs, so we wouldn't be able to help if you run into technical issues or malicious content that might be hiding in your app.  We aren't currently banning specifically for using a skin mod, butt it's at your own risk and we can change our stance on that at any time.  Check out our [third party guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848) as well for more details.  I'd suggest caution and to just not do it.  I hope that helps!
Oh, because I recently got permabanned for malicious 3rd party programs even though I don't script. So that must've been it.

in technicality, no. To riot, this is a grey zone area. a do at your own risk kind of thing. the only time when modding is bannable is when it gives you an unfair advantage, such as infinite IP/RP, aiming tools, infinite gold etc etc etc. things that give you a huge unfair advantage. And texture modding is....well...textures. and it doesn't give you a unfair advantage since it only applies to you, and not them, since your files are different than theirs and it's just altered pictures. so if you did a Project: {{champion:103}}  skin mod, you will see it, but others will see only the selected skin. So it is TECHNICALLY legal, but it's one of those Do-At-Your-Own-Risk kind of things.

Say if you use classic Zac and mod it to be a custom skin. you can see that skin, but they can only see origional skin. there is no advantage in that because it's not giving you any kind of advantage. because they see a normal skin. Texture modding is just that it's just modding body textures for JUST YOU. THEY will see Classic Lux, but you will see Dark Star Lux, for example. nothing more, nothing less. texture modding is litterally just changing the appearance, like how some games allow you to change the way your character looks. is that an unfair advantage? no.
